node.title: Queensland passes vaccination threshold for easing of mask rules
node.alt: Close up of a blue mask being taken off someone's face.
node.description: Queensland meets the state government's threshold for the easing of mask rules, with 80.1 per cent of the state's population over 16 now at least partially vaccinated.
node.content:
["Queensland has met the state government's threshold for the easing of mask rules,\u00a0with 80.1 per cent\u00a0of the state's\u00a0population over 16 now at least partially vaccinated.", "Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk said yesterday people in south-east Queensland\u00a0would no longer\u00a0need to wear masks indoors, including at schools, workplaces, cafes, pubs, clubs\u00a0and hairdressers \"the minute\" 80 per cent of people over 16 had received one vaccine dose.", "\"Queenslanders have done an incredible job all through the pandemic and this is their reward,\" Ms Palaszczuk said yesterday when announcing the plan to relax the rules.", "Under federal rules, masks need to remain mandatory in airports and planes.", "They are also strongly recommended for public transport and places where people cannot socially distance anywhere across Queensland.", "However, Health Minister Yvette D'Ath said the masks should not be thrown away.", "\"Masks have been an excellent defence against the spread of COVID and it's\u00a0more than likely we will need them again,\" she said.\u00a0", "Of Queenslanders over 16, 68.3 per cent have now had two doses of a COVID-19\u00a0vaccine.", "Vaccine coordinator police Deputy Commissioner Shane Chelepy said on Monday he expected Queensland would hit the double-dose milestone about a month\u00a0after the 80 per cent single-dose mark was reached.", "\"Around about four weeks \u2026 because we still do a lot of Moderna vaccinations, which is a four-week gap and we've still got a little bit of AstraZeneca being vaccinated, so it's around about the four weeks after we get our first dose but it does depend on which vaccine is being used the most,\" he said.", "For many council areas across south-east Queensland, mask restrictions have been in place since June 29, after an unvaccinated Brisbane hospital worker who had holidayed in Townsville and Magnetic Island tested positive to COVID-19.", "A series of subsequent community cases meant the mask rule has been kept in place across Greater Brisbane, the Gold Coast\u00a0and surrounding areas.", "", "
Outbreak: How Australia lost control of the Delta variant
"]
